text: I'm Adam Evans and I'm the executive
chef of the optimist in Atlanta Georgia
yeah we bring in a lot of whole fish and
the idea is so that we can use the
entire fish just like people will get
whole pigs and big primal cuts of beef
in the restaurant we like to get whole
fish because we feel like we can use
those in different areas of the
restaurant so today we're going to break
down a whole halibut the hell biz is a
massive fish it's a flatfish so when
you're breaking it down there's all
these different parts as a collar
there's an outside part that I call a
skirt and then it of course there's a
loin in the bones we use as well so
we'll do a few different dishes off of
that so for the halibut you start at the
head and go to the tail is that there's
actually a line on the Fitch that you
can follow so if you take the line and
you cut straight down it produces four
fillets it's a really easy pitch to
break down I think the collar is really
fun and it's something that I like to
order when I go to restaurants to see it
on the menu because you know it's going
to be fresh and you know the chef is
excited about it because if they've cut
it off the fish and you know whether
they're preparing it fried or roasted or
grilled or whatever it's it's just an
interesting cut from the fish but the
filets and the loin is what we're really
after so right now we're doing it with a
light cornmeal crust we take some fresh
kale and we shave it super thin
and we'll dress that Kell with lemon
juice a little bacon fat and warm bacon
and then we sear the cornmeal crusted
fish finish it with a little butter and
herb and dress the plate with a little
pepper jelly when we have all the cuts
that we want out of the halibut will
take the bones and roast them to a nice
golden brown color and then actually put
them in a bill base sauce and make a red
wine fish Bordelaise sauce and it's
really it's a really strong sauce but
it's got a really nice fish flavor to it
it's one of my favorite fish the flavor
of the halibut is it's something that I
look forward to tasting
